text.name: sys_description
text.text: MAME, an acronym for "Multiple Arcade Machine Emulator", is an emulator whose goal is to faithfully reproduce how arcade games work to preserve the history of video games. MAME is available on almost all platforms thanks to Libretro and the first public release of Nicola Salmoria, released on February 5, 1997. Version 0.78 of 2003 is the lightest version and capable of running fine on small systems like a Raspberry. And "Plus" means that its drivers have been back ported from recent versions to handle many more games or with les bugs than the original one.
